column1: Table D1.18.3: Persons (18 and over) reporting high/very high levels of psychological distress, by Indigenous status, remoteness, age, sex and jurisdiction, 2017–18 and 2018–19(a)(b)
† Estimate has a relative standard error between 25% and 50% and should be used with caution.
‡ Estimate has a relative standard error greater than 50% and is considered too unreliable for general use.
(a) Based on the Kessler-5 (K5) measure of psychological distress. Overall levels of distress are based on frequency responses. High/very high is based on a score of 12–25.
(b) Rates and percentages are directly age-standardised to the 2001 Australian standard population, using 10 year age groups up to 55+.
(d) Rate ratio is calculated by dividing the Indigenous rate by the non-Indigenous rate.
(e) Persons aged 18 and over reporting high levels of psychological distress per 100 persons aged 18 and over.
(g) Data for specific age groups are not age-standardised, only the totals.
Note: Cells in this table have been randomly adjusted to avoid the release of confidential data. Discrepancies may occur between sums of the component items and totals.
Sources: AIHW and ABS analysis of National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Health Survey 2018–19 and National Health Survey 2017–18.
